verses.text: Now when Jacob saw that there was corn in Egypt, Jacob said to his sons, Why do ye look one upon another?
And he said, Behold, I have heard that there is corn in Egypt: go down thither, and buy for us from thence; that we may live, and not die.
And Joseph's ten brethren went down to buy corn in Egypt.
But Benjamin, Joseph's brother, Jacob sent not with his brethren: for he said, Lest perhaps mischief shall befall him.
And the sons of Israel came to buy \add corn\add* among those that came: for the famine was in the land of Canaan.

And Joseph \add was\add* the governor over the land, \add and\add* he \add it was\add* that sold to all the people of the land: and Joseph's brethren came, and bowed themselves before him \add with\add* their faces to the earth.
And Joseph saw his brethren, and he knew them, but made himself strange to them, and spoke roughly to them; and he said to them, Whence come ye? And they said, From the land of Canaan to buy food.
And Joseph knew his brethren, but they knew not him.
And Joseph remembered the dreams which he dreamed of them, and said to them, Ye \add are\add* spies; to see the nakedness of the land have ye come.
And they said to him, No, my lord, but to buy food have thy servants come.
We \add are\add* all one man's sons; we \add are\add* true \add men\add*; thy servants are no spies.
And he said to them, No, but to see the nakedness of the land have ye come.
And they said, Thy servants \add are\add* twelve brethren, the sons of one man in the land of Canaan; and behold, the youngest \add is\add* this day with our father, and one \add is\add* not.
And Joseph said to them, That \add is\add* what I spoke to you, saying, Ye \add are\add* spies:
By this ye shall be proved: By the life of Pharaoh ye shall not go forth hence, except your youngest brother shall come hither.

Send one of you, and let him bring your brother, and ye shall be kept in prison, that your words may be proved, whether \add there is any\add* truth in you: or else by the life of Pharaoh surely ye \add are\add* spies.
And he put them all together into custody three days.
And Joseph said to them the third day, This do, and live; \add for\add* I fear God:
If ye \add are\add* true \add men\add*, let one of your brethren be bound in the house of your prison: go ye, carry corn for the famine of your houses:
But bring your youngest brother to me; so shall your words be verified, and ye shall not die. And they did so.

And they said one to another, We \add are\add* verily guilty concerning our brother, in that we saw the anguish of his soul, when he besought us, and we would not hear; therefore is this distress come upon us.
And Reuben answered them, saying, Did I not speak to you, saying, Do not sin against the young man; and ye would not hear? therefore behold also his blood is required.
And they knew not that Joseph understood \add them\add*; for he spoke to them by an interpreter.
And he turned himself away from them, and wept; and returned to them again, and communed with them, and took from them Simeon, and bound him before their eyes.
Then Joseph commanded to fill their sacks with corn, and to restore every man's money into his sack, and to give them provision for the way: and thus did he to them.
And they loaded their asses with the corn, and departed thence.
And as one of them opened his sack to give his ass provender in the inn, he espied his money: for behold, it \add was\add* in his sack's mouth.

And he said to his brethren, My money is restored; and see \add it is\add* even in my sack: and their heart failed \add them\add*, and they were afraid, saying one to another, What \add is\add* this \add that\add* God hath done to us?
And they came to Jacob their father to the land of Canaan, and told him all that befell them, saying,
The man \add who is\add* the lord of the land, spoke roughly to us, and took us for spies of the country.
And we said to him, We \add are\add* true \add men\add*; we are no spies:
We \add are\add* twelve brethren, sons of our father: one \add is\add* not, and the youngest \add is\add* this day with our father in the land of Canaan.

And the man, the lord of the country, said to us, By this shall I know that ye \add are\add* true \add men\add*: leave one of your brethren \add here\add* with me, and take \add food for\add* the famine of your households, and depart:

And bring your youngest brother to me: then shall I know that ye \add are\add* no spies, but \add that\add* ye \add are\add* true \add men\add*: then will I deliver to you your brother, and ye shall traffick in the land.
And it came to pass as they emptied their sacks, that behold, every man's bundle of money \add was\add* in his sack; and when they and their father saw the bundles of money, they were afraid.
And Jacob their father said to them, Me have ye bereaved: Joseph \add is\add* not, and Simeon \add is\add* not, and ye will take Benjamin \add away\add*: all these things are against me.
And Reuben spoke to his father, saying, Slay my two sons, if I bring him not to thee: deliver him into my hand, and I will bring him to thee again.

And he said, My son shall not go down with you; for his brother is dead, and he is left alone: if mischief shall befall him by the way in which ye go, then will ye bring down my gray hairs with sorrow to the grave.
